alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 4:01PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New Mexico, including the following county, Chaves. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 359 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving slowly northwest across the Roswell area. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen over parts of the area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roswell, Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge, Bottomless Lakes State Park and Midway. - This includes the following highways... Highway 380 between Mile Markers 156 and 162. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 99 and 119. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
